TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed KeyNumber extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies whether to create an asymmetric signature key or an asymmetric exchange key.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the KeyNumber enumeration with the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CspKeyContainerInfo.KeyNumber%2A> property to inspect a key type or with the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CspParameters.KeyNumber> field to specify a key type.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the KeyNumber enumeration to specify a key type for an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSACryptoServiceProvider> object.
[!code-cs[Cryptography.KeyNumber#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.security.crypto_62_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[Cryptography.KeyNumber#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.security.crypto_62_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[Cryptography.KeyNumber#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.security.crypto_62_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.KeyNumber Exchange = int32(1)

Docs.summary: An exchange key pair used to encrypt session keys so that they can be safely stored and exchanged with other users.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value corresponds to the AT_KEYEXCHANGE value used in the unmanaged Microsoft Cryptographic API (CAPI).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.KeyNumber Signature = int32(2)

Docs.summary: A signature key pair used for authenticating digitally signed messages or files.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value corresponds to the AT_SIGNATURE value used in the unmanaged Microsoft Cryptographic API (CAPI).
